title: The 4 Easiest Ways to Reset Your Instagram Explore Page

steps.title: Go to the Explore page.
steps.content: Go to the Explore page. If you're seeing the same posts and reels on the Explore page and want to check out something new, you can use this method to do a quick refresh. Open the Instagram app and tap the magnifying glass icon at the bottom of your screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Pull down from the top of your screen.
steps.content: Pull down from the top of your screen. On the Explore page, you will see a variety of posts and reels that Instagram thinks you'll like. Pull down from the top of the screen to refresh this content. Once done, you should see a whole new set of images and videos. This is the quickest and easiest way to reset your Instagram Explore page, but it won't change the type of content you'll see. Instagram builds your Explore page based on how you use Instagram, including the posts you've liked and shared, the accounts you follow , and who you're connected to. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Go to the Instagram Explore page.
steps.content: Go to the Instagram Explore page. Open the Instagram app and tap the magnifying glass icon at the bottom of your screen. If you're seeing posts you don't like on your Explore page, there's an easy way to tweak the algorithm to see better results. [3] X Research source You can use this method to mark the Explore posts you don't like as "Not Interested," which will improve your recommendations over time. This is the most effective way to reset your Explore page, although you won't see a drastic change immediately. The more posts and reels you mark as Not Interested, the better your Explore page will be.

steps.title: Tap on a tile that does not interest you.
steps.content: Tap on a tile that does not interest you. Choose any photo or video that contains something you'd rather not see on your Explore page.

steps.title: Tap the three vertical dots.
steps.content: Tap the three vertical dots. You'll see this dots at the top-right or bottom-right corner of the video or post, depending on the type of content.

steps.title: Tap Not interested.
steps.content: Tap Not interested . This hides the selected post or reel from your Explore page and instructs Instagram to show you less of that type of content. [4] X Research source You may then choose to provide Instagram with additional information, citing words or phrases that you no longer want to see, or notifying the company that this specific post made you uncomfortable.

steps.title: Repeat the process for other posts to refine your explorer page.
steps.content: Repeat the process for other posts to refine your explorer page. Continue to find unwanted posts and label them as "Not interested" . Over time, this work should tailor your Instagram Explore page to more closely match your interests and needs. [5] X Research source This is the only way to reset your Explore page within the app. Clearing your search history will not impact the content on your Explore page.

steps.title: Navigate to your Android's Settings.
steps.content: Navigate to your Android's Settings. You can look for the Settings app, or you can pull down from the top of your screen and tap the gear icon located within your notifications menu. [6] X Research source Clearing your Instagram app data and cache won't fully reset your Explore page, but it can help to bring you newer content you may not have seen otherwise.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . On some Android phones and tablets, this option is represented by a group of dots forming a grid. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Select Instagram.
steps.content: Select Instagram . You may have to select See all apps first. Or, if you have a Samsung Galaxy, you can type Instagram into the search field to find it.

steps.title: Tap Storage & cache or Storage.
steps.content: Tap Storage & cache or Storage . Here, you can see the space taken up by the Instagram app on your phone. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear Cache and/or Clear Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Cache and/or Clear Data . At the very least, clear the cache. These are residual files that build up over time and may include bits of personal data that dictate what appears on your Explore page. [9] X Research source Clearing Instagram's data is more likely to help reset your Explore page, but keep in mind that this clears the app's settings entirely. After clearing the data, you will need to sign in to Instagram again. Clearing the cache can prove helpful whenever an app is slow or unresponsive.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings app. It is represented by a group of overlapping gears. [10] X Research source Unlike Android, you can't clear your Instagram data or cache without deleting and reinstalling the app. Keep in mind that this will log you out of Instagram, so you'll need to sign in again after downloading the app.

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . You'll see this in the third group of settings.

steps.title: Tap iPhone Storage.
steps.content: Tap iPhone Storage . It's near the middle of the menu. Here, you should see all the apps taking up storage on your device. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Instagram.
steps.content: Tap Instagram . Scroll until you find Instagram, and then tap on it.

steps.title: Delete the app.
steps.content: Delete the app. Tap the red button reading "Delete App" and then follow the on-screen instructions to confirm. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Download Instagram from the App Store .
steps.content: Download Instagram from the App Store . Now that you've deleted the Instagram app, you'll need to reinstall it from the App Store. Once you sign back in, your Explore page will be refreshed, although it will still display content based your history. [13] X Research source
